# 'branch merge' skips multiple already-merged branches in a stack.

as 'Test <test@example.com>'
at '2024-04-05T16:40:32Z'

# setup
cd repo
git init
git commit --allow-empty -m 'Initial commit'

# set up a fake GitHub remote
shamhub init
shamhub new origin alice/example.git
shamhub register alice
git push origin main

env SHAMHUB_USERNAME=alice
gs auth login

# create a stack: main -> feature1 -> feature2 -> feature3
git add feature1.txt
gs bc feature1 -m 'Add feature 1'
git add feature2.txt
gs bc feature2 -m 'Add feature 2'
git add feature3.txt
gs bc feature3 -m 'Add feature 3'

# submit the full stack
gs downstack submit --fill
stderr 'Created #1'
stderr 'Created #2'
stderr 'Created #3'

# merge feature1 and feature2 externally
shamhub merge alice/example 1
shamhub merge alice/example 2

# branch merge should skip both and merge only feature3.
# Use --no-branch-check because the external merges
# would trigger stale base validation.
env ROBOT_INPUT=$WORK/robot-merge.golden ROBOT_OUTPUT=$WORK/robot-merge.actual
gs branch merge --no-branch-check
cmp $WORK/robot-merge.actual $WORK/robot-merge.golden
stderr 'feature1.*already merged, skipping'
stderr 'feature2.*already merged, skipping'
stderr 'Merging feature3'
! stderr 'Retargeting'

-- repo/feature1.txt --
This is feature 1
-- repo/feature2.txt --
This is feature 2
-- repo/feature3.txt --
This is feature 3
-- robot-merge.golden --
===
> Merge 1 change(s) bottom-up?: [Y/n]
>   feature3 (#3)
true
